alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:49PM EST until January 10 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maryland... Seneca Creek at Dawsonville affecting Montgomery County. For the Seneca Creek...including Dawsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Seneca Creek at Dawsonville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Portions of the Seneca Creek Greenway are flooded. A small portion of Berryville Road west of Darnestown begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.8 feet, or 0.7 feet below flood stage. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 8.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.1 feet on 02/22/2003. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1AM 7AM 1PM Stg Time Date Seneca Creek Dawsonville 7.5 6.8 Tue 8 pm 8.1 8.1 5.7 8.1 1am Wed &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 900 AM EST.
